title: Stamford Immigration Forum: Extend HUSKY & Protect Immigrants
description:
The attacks on our immigrant communities are escalating, but so is our determination to build people power! We‚Äôre seeing ICE kidnap people from our communities and disappear them to foreign prisons. Our CT Elected officials MUST stand on the right side of history.

Join us for a Community Immigration Forum in Stamford where we will hear from community members, elected officials, and allies on why protecting and extending HUSKY for Immigrants and passing the TRUST Act are key actions CT can take to protect immigrant communities, and how YOU can take immediate action in support of our immigrant community members.

üîµ When: Sunday, May 18th, 2:00pm to 4:00pm

üîµ Where: Unitarian Universalist Congregation | 20 Forest St, Stamford, CT 06901


Connecticut has made remarkable progress - In the last 4 years, the HUSKY for Immigrants coalition successfully expanded HUSKY coverage to over 19,000 undocumented children ages 0-15 and to undocumented pregnant people. We cannot let CT move backward.
 
**What are we fighting for?**

üó£Ô∏è Protect our progress and maintain HUSKY Medicaid coverage for undocumented children age 15 and under, and pregnant individuals.

üó£Ô∏è Raise the age for HUSKY eligibility up to age 26, for all income-eligible residents regardless of immigration status.

üó£Ô∏è Pass the TRUST Act (HB 7212), a bill that would protect our CT immigrant community from ICE abductions and protect CT local resources from being used to further mass deportations.

Stamford is and must continue to be a welcoming place for all our residents, where all of us, regardless of race, religion, sexual orientation, and immigration status, can feel safe!!

*Sponsoring organizations of the event include: the HUSKY 4 Immigrants Coalition, TRUST Act, NOW Coalition, 32BJ, Social Justice Committee of the UU Congregation in Stamford, UPSS - United Parents For Students Sucesss, Interfaith Council of Southwestern Connecticut, Stamford Indivisible, Comunidades Sin Frontreras, UPASS, Nosotr@s, and other local organizations. *

title: [Member-led] Political Instagram 101
description:
Come learn how to use Instagram to share and consume political content! 

Learn how to use this wildly popular social media platform to gain insights into news, politics, and funny jokes, as well as how to share your activism with the world (or just close friends!)

While social media and misinformation have led to a lot of today's problems, when used correctly, it can be a powerful way to stay informed in real time and activate more pro-democracy neighbors in the fight against authoritarianism.

title: Albuquerque, NM: Stop Factory Farms Meetup!
description:
Want to take action to stop factory farms this summer but don‚Äôt know where to start? Come out to our volunteer meetup in Bennie Hargrove Park Saturday to learn more about how you can advocate for a better food system for all!

We know factory farms make us sick, abuse our scarce water resources, and make it harder for small and medium-sized family farms to stay in business. We need a food system that works for everyone, and we know it's possible if we fight for it together.

At the meetup, we‚Äôll talk about our campaign to stop factory farms in New Mexico. You‚Äôll get to meet other volunteers passionate about the issue, chat about your volunteer interests, and take action. Hope to see you there!

description:
# Our Joy is Resistance!

### Join us for our post legislative Session Celebration!

To recognize the incredible, tough, and inspiring work you have done during the harrowing legislative session, we are holding Volunteer Celebrations to uplift and celebrate YOU! We are nearly halfway through 2025, and there is so much happening that requires us to protect our peace, and treasure those moments of joy! So it is imperative that we come together, fill our cups and **celebrate the resistance of JOY!!** 

At the celebration I will be sharing my large collection of game boards for all to share and enjoy fellowship with each other while we share a meal Please let us know when you sign up if there are any dietary needs we should consider. 

Sometimes it can feel like the hard work we put in yields nothing in return - but there has been SO MUCH good that has come from your work, and we can‚Äôt wait to celebrate it all with you!

We want you to have FUN!! Feel free to invite friends, family or chosen family, coworkers, etc!!

- Recommended first steps for exploring a run for office

No matter what stage you are at in your candidate journey, you'll leave the call with clear next steps and actions to take to advance you through the process.

title: Own Your Power: Say NO to another NVEnergy utility rate increase!
description:
Nevada Energy wants to raise prices. They're asking the government (specifically, the Public Utilities Commission of Nevada or PUCN) to let them collect $215.7 million more each year from people who use electricity.

They're also asking to raise the amount of profit they're allowed to make. Right now, they're allowed to earn a certain percentage on the money they invest‚Äîkind of like interest‚Äîbut they want to increase that to 7.95% overall and 10.25% for their shareholders.

Let's show the PUCN that we won‚Äôt let our hard-earned money fill the pockets of greedy out-of-state shareholders and corporations. Together, we can keep our energy 100% clean, affordable, and reliable for all. Take action to oppose NV Energy's rate increase proposal.

title: Win Elections, Rebuild Democracy with Swing Left

address_lines: This event‚Äôs address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event‚Äôs address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Working together, we can take a critical first step toward rebuilding democracy. **Join our gathering at my home in the Elkins Park area to connect, commiserate, and conspire‚Äì we‚Äôll learn more about Swing Left‚Äôs strategy and make a plan to take action together.**

The chaos fueled by Trump‚Äôs authoritarian ambitions and Musk‚Äôs reckless influence can make the future feel bleak. But we‚Äôre not powerless and the numbers show just how close we are to taking back control. 

In 2024, Democrats lost the House by 3 seats and just 7,309 votes total‚Äîthe narrowest House majority in almost 100 years. 

**With such a narrow margin, winning the House is doable.** And it‚Äôs also the most impactful thing we can do to halt the destructive Trump, Musk, and Project 2025 agenda. Calling Congress and supporting lawsuits help to slow the bleeding, but elections will remove legislators from office. A House victory will give Democrats a critical federal lever: more power and more oversight to investigate government actions and political corruption, effectively stopping the MAGA legislative agenda in its tracks.

More about the candidates: 

Throughout nearly thirty years of working and living within the Beaverton School District, Eric McGuire has been engaged in making academic outcomes equitable for all students as an educator and BSD parent.Being guided by curiosity, kindness, a passion for public education and a sincere desire for equitable schools for all, he wishes to bring his knowledge and experience to the Beaverton School Board as a representative of Zone 2.

description:
Join Next Up Action Fund as we phone bank to support Portland Public School Board Candidates Jorge Bautista Sanchez for Zone 5 and Rashelle Chase Miller for Zone 4 ‚ú®

We'll make sure everyone is trained on how to phone bank using an autodialer and feel prepared to talk through vote plans with voters while sharing about Jorge and Rashelle's prioritizes!

More about the candidates:

Jorge Sanchez Bautista is running for Portland School Board in NE Portland (Zone 5, but elected citywide!) to ensure students are a priority and that we are fully funding public education. A native Portlander, he was raised in the Cully neighborhood and is a student, community organizer, and an educational advocate. With experience passing legislative bills, advocating for change, and being a student in Portland Public Schools all of his life, he is ready to bring change and advocate for all.

Rashelle Chase-Miller is a mom, an early childhood educator, a literacy advocate and a fifth-generation North Portlander. With over 25 years of experience in early childhood education, she's dedicated her career to promoting equitable access to high-quality learning experiences for all children and their families. Currently, she serve as the statewide Program Director for SMART Reading, where she's committed to fostering a love of reading among children across Oregon by helping them build their own home libraries while providing reading support.

title: Juneteenth Celebration: Week of Resistance with Power, Purpose, and People!
description:
This Juneteenth, we're not just celebrating our ancestors' freedom. Our theme this year is "Resist." We're resisting tyranny and answering the call to defend our freedom. Join us for the Juneteenth: Week of Resistance, a powerful week-long series of events from June 13th to 21st, honoring our people's strength, spirit, and strategy in the face of ongoing attacks on our rights, voices, and communities.

Resistance Summit:
We're kicking off our celebration with the Resistance Summit on June 13th, 10 am to 4 pm, at Gethsemane Missionary Baptist Church, 29066 Eton Street, Westland, MI. This teach-in will explain why resistance is necessary. With immigration raids on the rise, voting rights under attack, and civil liberties being stripped away, we'll learn how to push back, protect each other, and build the power to win.

Buycott:
From June 15th - 21st, join the Buycott! From the Montgomery Bus Boycott to boycotting Target, our economic resistance has always been rooted in purpose! As programs like DEI are dismantled, we're doubling down on supporting businesses that honor our history, hire us, and respect our buying power. Let's move our money with intention and invest in those who invest and hire us.

Cookout:
We're closing out strong with our annual Juneteenth Cookout on June 21st, 11 am - 5 pm at Inkster Park, 1550-1676 John Daly St, Inkster, MI. Come through for the food, the music, and the joy that only we know how to create, even in the face of struggle. This is more than a party. It's a declaration that we're still here and rising and know how to turn pain into power.

Bring your squad, your appetite, and your dancing shoes. It's time to celebrate freedom, resistance, and us! Register now and share this with your friends!

title: Step Up CD-8: Peoria Protest (Lake Pleasant Pkwy & Happy Valley Rd)
description:
üìç **Location:** Lake Pleasant Pkwy & Happy Valley Rd.  
üóì **Date:** Saturday, May 10, 2025  
‚è∞ **Time:** 8:00 AM ‚Äì 9:30 AM  


(Looking for a different Step Up location? Go to [linktr.ee/stepupcd8](https://linktr.ee/stepupcd8).)  


We‚Äôre standing up to **Donald Trump** because **Rep. Abe Hamadeh won‚Äôt**!  


Join your neighbors for a peaceful, high-visibility protest as part of the **Step Up CD-8 multi-site protest**.  


While Trump and his billionaire friends dismantle our government for their own personal gain, CD-8 Congressman **Abe Hamadeh has been hiding from constituents** behind closed-door events with donors and MAGA voters.  


For months, concerned constituents across CD-8 have asked Rep. Abe Hamadeh to hold a public town hall and listen to the concerns of the people he was elected to represent. Instead, we‚Äôve been met with silence ‚Äî and even **threats of arrest**.  


When we demonstrated peacefully outside his office, his staff **had a senior adult woman‚Äôs car towed**. When our numbers grew, Hamadeh coordinated with GOP counter-protestors to **obstruct our access to a public sidewalk**.  


**It‚Äôs clear: Hamadeh answers to Trump, not to us.**  


So on **May 10**, we‚Äôre taking the message to five cities across CD-8:  
**Enough.**  

---

### We'll be at the following locations:

- Lake Pleasant Pkwy & Happy Valley Rd in **Peoria**
- Anthem Way & Gavilan Peak Pkwy in **Anthem**

title: Portland Pride Tabling/Signature Gathering
description:
Join Basic Rights Oregon (BRO) at Portland Pride 2025! 

Every year, we invite members of our LGBTQ2SIA+ community and allies to join us to table at Pride. 

As we continue to see bans on our bodily autonomy, and bans on our ability to safely exist in public, we are embarking on a ballot measure campaign, Equal Rights for All. This campaign seeks to codify access to gender affirming care, reproductive healthcare, and marriage equality into the Oregon constitution. 

ER4A gives Oregon voters a chance to enshrine these values. We need to gather over 250,000 signatures to get on the ballot in 2026. Joining us at pride this year is a chance to celebrate and advocate for a better Oregon.

We will be collecting signatures, sharing our work, and giving away goodies to all who stop by our booth. 

We hope you'll join us! Contact jose@basicrights.org with questions.

title: Food & Water Justice: Defending Our Food and Water in the Courts [Livable Future LIVE]
description:
Food & Water Watch‚Äôs legal team, Food & Water Justice, is working in the courts to defend protections for safe food, clean water, and a livable climate as the Trump/Musk Administration takes aim at bedrock environmental law and the rule of law itself. 

**Join us to hear from Food & Water Watch‚Äôs Legal Director Tarah Heinzen and allies about how we‚Äôre challenging illegal regulatory rollbacks and industry attacks on protections for clean water, family farms, and the climate.** 

We know the Musk-Trump administration will stop at nothing to gut our environmental and public health regulations, but we have a plan to fight back in the courts, while moving forward an ambitious agenda to make progress at the state level.

title: WE Dems Book Club

address_lines: This event‚Äôs address is private. Sign up for more details
location.venue: This event‚Äôs address is private. Sign up for more details

description:
Our constitutional rights are under a barrage of threats from the ultra-right; we cannot bury our heads in the sand, hoping someone else will come to save us. WE must use knowledge, critical thinking and connection with others to save ourselves and our democracy.  And we must ACT quickly.  

We're focusing on hard things, but we'll lead with humor and hope and we'll let positivity and a belief in our indomitable American spirit fuel our work rejecting authoritarianism!

** 2nd Tuesdays of every other month **

May 20- Saving Democracy: A user's manual for every American (David Pepper)

- The book details how we all can and must play a role in saving democracy at this fraught time.
-It explains how all levels of the pro-democracy side, from national political leaders to grassroots activists to everyday Americans, must switch to offense, stay on offense and win on offense. 

Immediately, and everywhere.

But it doesn't do this at 30,000 feet.

It's a user's manual, intended to spur action. Your action. After a quick review of the true battle for democracy we are engaged in, each chapter explains how YOU, the reader, can and must play the leading role in lifting democracy. It details the concrete steps individuals and groups can take where you live, lists resources that can help along the way, and offers case studies and best practices that have worked elsewhere

Purchase the book HERE or at your local independent book store.  
https://bookshop.org/p/books/saving-democracy-a-user-s-manual-for-every-american-david-pepper/20075262

Next Meetings/ Books:

July 8- 50 Ways to Love Your Country (MoveOn.org)

title: NVM 2025 May Volunteer Meeting: Primary Kickoff
description:
Join us on Zoom for our May Volunteer Meeting! We will be kicking off our field work ahead of the June Democratic Primary. Come hear about New Virginia Majority's mission, Primary endorsements, strategy, and event rollout.

A Zoom link will be sent out the day before the meeting.



Community Rules of Conduct and Engagement:

By signing up for this event, we assume that you will fully abide by our Community Standards and Rules of Engagement. If a volunteer is in violation of any one of these standards, they will be removed and barred from future events at our discretion. We do this in order to protect our staff and volunteers as well as create a safe and welcoming environment.

I will respect NVM staff who have organized this meeting as well as my fellow volunteers by being conscious of our time restraints, avoiding using harsh/foul language, and giving everyone a chance to speak. We will assume good intent of all participants and staff.

NVM organizes around and centers the needs of working class communities of color. Please keep in mind that the strategies & messaging we use have been developed to keep those communities at the center of our work. Therefore, the strategies & messaging we use may not match up with your specific expectations and may be different from what you've experienced working with other volunteer organizations. Please keep this in mind as we work together to build a more equitable Virginia that is home to all.

I recognize the reality that there could be changes regarding the scheduling of this event and its agenda. We will do our best to give you advanced notice if and when changes are made.

I will NOT share the zoom information or any internal documentation with anyone else. We ask this for our own security.

title: Postcarding & Conversation with Ben Max of Max Politics Podcast
description:
We strive to build community, educate voters, and use our Sharpies to write to save democracy together. Join us to write postcards, talk about the news, and hear from candidates and political leaders. 

Please answer the registration questions accurately and completely. If this is your first time joining this group, please sign on at least 15 minutes before the speaker start time listed below. Compliance with these requests will facilitate admission to our Zoom meeting.

**Ben Max of Max Politics Podcast will join us at 10:00am on Friday, May 9.** Ben Max is the Executive Editor and Program Director of the Center for New York City and State Law at New York Law School (NYLS) and Host of the Max Politics podcast where he interviews leading figures in New York politics and policy, including several of the candidates running in the NYC municipal elections. Previously, Ben spent ten years as the Executive Editor of Gotham Gazette, a nonprofit news publication focused on NYC and NYS government, policy, and politics. Before he started covering New York politics, Ben worked in K-12 education, mostly as a high school history teacher. He grew up in Queens and lives in Brooklyn. Come prepared with your questions about New York politics, including the current citywide races.

Write postcards with us or just join the conversation. If you need help getting started with postcarding, please visit our [FAQ](https://markersfordemocracy.org/postcarding/postcarding-faq).

If you are with the media and want to attend, you must notify us at markersfordemocracy@gmail.com at least two hours before the start of the event. All discussions are off the record.

This event is co-hosted by [Markers For Democracy](https://markersfordemocracy.org), [Downtown Nasty Women Social Group](https://linktr.ee/DNWSG), and [Team Min](https://linktr.ee/teammin
).

title: Know Means Know: Building Power Through Connection
description:
Have you ever thought, ‚ÄúI know my friends and family care ‚Äî I just wish they‚Äôd get involved‚Äù? You‚Äôre not alone. Come to this month‚Äôs Know Means Know webinar and we will show you how to use a technique called relational organizing to turn the connections you already have with people you know into meaningful action for sex education at the school board level. You‚Äôll help your friends reach out to their own school board members and engage them to do the same with their own circles. That‚Äôs how real momentum starts ‚Äî with a small group of people who work together to make a difference. 
In just one hour you‚Äôll:

* Hear from people who‚Äôve used relational organizing to build real change in their community.

* Try it out with real-time support from experts

* Learn how to develop and run your own low-cost relational organizing campaign 

* Have a chance to win a $25 gift card just for taking action

Want to know more? Meet our presenters:

Louise Walpin is a retired Psychiatric Advanced Practice Nurse. She is the Director of Advocacy and Organizing for SWEEP NJ, a statewide grassroots advocacy group with over 3000 members.  Louise worked closely with the bill sponsors to pass the Freedom to Read Act and is currently focused on bills to protect transgender healthcare and the immigrant community. 
 Louise, and her wife of 36 years, were the lead couple in the 2009-2013 legislative fight for marriage equality, as well as one of the lead plaintiff couples in the Lambda Legal lawsuit that secured marriage for same sex couples in NJ.  Louise‚Äôs activism has earned her annual recognition on the Insider NJ LGBTQ Power List, as well as Assemblywoman Sumter‚Äôs Women Power List.  When not engaged in activism, you can usually find Louise with her grandchildren, horse or dog.


James Herrmann is the Campaigns Director at Empower Project. He began his career during the 2016 election cycle in New York and Ohio and has since worked across the country for progressive causes and campaigns. James specializes in relational organizing, fundraising, and campaign management, and he partners with campaigns, state democratic parties and organizations nationwide to build strong, people-powered programs.

title: Accountability Tuesdays - Jeff Van Drew has got to go!
description:
**Accountability Tuesdays: Van Drew, Meet with Us**

WE ARE DEMANDING A TOWN HALL - The excuse is that his district is too big and so all we get is tele town halls - 

**Host:**  
Atlantic County Indivisible

**When:**  
**Tuesday, April 29 2025 ‚Äî 4:30 PM**  
(Repeats every other Tuesday)

**Where:**  
**Jeff Van Drew‚Äôs District Office** 

Northfield Office

1001 Tilton Road
Suite 101
Northfield, NJ 08225
Phone: (609) 625-5008

**Event Description:**  
Congressman Jeff Van Drew is supposed to represent **us**‚Äîbut he only meets with **donors**, **special interests**, and **MAGA extremists**.

He hasn‚Äôt held a public town hall in years, and his voting record speaks for itself:
- **Voted against certifying the 2020 election results**
- Opposed **abortion rights**, **student loan forgiveness**, and **LGBTQ+ protections**
- Supports efforts to **defund public education** and deny the climate crisis
- Turns his back on working people and silences dissent in our district

So we show up. Peacefully. Persistently. Every other Tuesday.

> **Donors get the meetings. Constituents get ignored.**

We‚Äôre rallying outside his **Northfield District Office** to demand visibility, accountability, and representation. This is a **peaceful protest** to let our neighbors‚Äîand our congressman‚Äîknow we are watching.

**What to Bring:**
- Signs (or use ours!)  
- Friends, neighbors, coworkers  
- Water, weather-appropriate clothing  
- Your voice and your presence  

**Accessibility:**  
- Public sidewalk with parking nearby  
- No marching‚Äîstand or sit as long as you‚Äôd like  
- Family-friendly and open to all

We‚Äôve coordinated with local police to ensure a safe, orderly, nonviolent demonstration. Everyone who believes in democracy is welcome.

title: Grassroots Fundraising Training
description:
You Geared Up, you Protected & Resisted, you got on that dialer more times than you can count. Or maybe you haven‚Äôt yet been in the streets or on the phone banks, but you are ready to step into your power and build the movement!

Our work is to organize more white people than ever before into the movement for racial justice and towards communities that work for ALL of us. While this moment is dark, this movement‚Äôs future is bright, and to build all that‚Äôs possible, it needs to be funded. 

Come build your skills in preparation for the Spring Grassroots Fundraising Drive where a team of SURJ members from all over the country (including YOU?!), will spend 10 days collectively raising over $100,000! 

Sign up for ONE of these two training times!

Our movements are most powerful when they‚Äôre funded by the base (that‚Äôs you!). Grassroots fundraising has been part of every successful movement in U.S. history, and it is being criminalized (like Trump going after ActBlue) precisely because organizing money is so powerful. 

Fundraising in community gives us the capacity to organize more people, share the work of SURJ with new people and invite them into our work. We need your help to grow the base of people putting money on the line to challenge authoritarianism.

The Spring Fundraising Drive is a 10-day ‚Äúsprint‚Äù from May 28-June 6. This fundraising drive is open for all SURJ members, new and experienced, from all class backgrounds. 

Attendance at ONE of these two trainings is the first step to participate. We‚Äôll get skilled up and prepare for the array of good, and sometimes sticky, conversations you‚Äôll have about money as a donor organizer. See you there!

‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî‚Äî

*‚ÄúMaking my goal was a very rejuvenating experience. After the fundraising drive, I felt more grounded in my SURJ membership than ever, and it was a surprising joy to share about my work with SURJ while asking for support from my community.‚Äù* - Elma, Grassroots Fundraiser, Spring ‚Äò24 

*‚ÄúI expected to be more nervous about reaching out to people from a few decades ago, but coaches and others suggested that people might be happy that I thought of them for this campaign. And that turned out to be very true! People thanked me for asking them for money and for giving them something to put their anxiety into!‚Äù* - Margaret, Grassroots Fundraiser, Fall ‚Äò24

title: Pennsylvania Alliance for Retired Americans Save Medicaid Phone Bank
description:
The US House of Representatives and Senate have passed a budget framework that would give a massive tax break to the wealthiest Americans by slashing Medicaid and SNAP. This budget blueprint would cut up to $880 billion from Medicaid in the next 10 years. If approved, this budget blueprint would be disastrous for Pennsylvania‚Äôs seniors and families.
Around 400,000 Pennsylvania seniors rely on Medicaid for essential health care, and Medicaid pays for the care of 5 out of every 8 nursing home residents in our state.

Join us in the fight to protect Medicaid, by signing up for our Save Medicaid online phone bank on Tuesday, May 13th, from 10:00 am -12:00 pm. Our phone bank will be calling seniors in Pennsylvania‚Äôs 7th and 8th Congressional Districts‚Äîin the Lehigh Valley and the Scranton area. Both these are swing districts represented by freshmen Republican congressmen who unseated Democratic incumbents last November. Many of Representative Mackenzie‚Äôs and Representative Bresnahan‚Äôs constituents rely on Medicaid for their healthcare. We will call seniors in those districts to encourage them to call their House Representatives to tell them they oppose cuts to Medicaid. 

Before making calls, PARA will provide all phone bank participants with a brief training on our phone banking system and a script to use when calling constituents. No phone banking experience is necessary to join us. Staff will be on hand to answer any questions and guide you through the process.

title: Join the National Day of Action for Single Payer Healthcare - Tillamook County
description:
## Tillamook for Universal Health Care
Saturday, May 31st | 1:30 PM ‚Äì 4:30 PM |
Tillamook County Library (Hatfield Room)

### Join us in Tillamook for a local gathering as part of the National Day of Action for Single Payer Health Care. 
This is a chance to come together, connect with neighbors, and learn more about the growing movement to win universal, publicly funded health care in Oregon.

Our current health care system is **expensive**, **confusing**, and often **denies** people the care they need. But real change is _possible_‚Äîand it starts with everyday Oregonians getting informed and organized.

#### What to Expect:

- A welcoming space to meet others in Tillamook who care about health care justice
- Updates on what‚Äôs happening in Oregon‚Äôs campaign for single payer
- Information on how to support the work locally and statewide
- A casual, community-centered gathering
- Time for group discussion and reflection

Whether you‚Äôve been organizing for years or are just starting to learn about the issue, this event is for _you_. It‚Äôs about building connection, learning together, and helping put Oregon on the path to a health care system that serves all of us‚Äînot just the wealthy few.

This is the Tillamook action in a nationwide day of events calling for health care as a human right. Come be part of the conversation‚Äîand the solution.

I want to hear from people directly impacted by Trump‚Äôs mass firings, the Republicans‚Äô $880 billion in Medicaid cuts, and other egregious attacks by this administration and its allies.

title: MAY DAY: WOODSTOCK WORKERS RISING
description:
üõ† DRESS THE PART. BRING A SIGN. STAND WITH WORKERS.

This May Day, we stand together as the people who keep this town running‚Äîworkers who teach our kids, care for the sick, grow our food, build our homes, and serve our neighbors.

No matter your job or background, we all deserve a fair shot: fair pay, personal freedom, safe communities, and leaders who work for us, not just for billionaires and backroom lobbyists.

Too many of those freedoms are being chipped away‚Äîby people in power who treat workers like a cost to cut, not a voice to listen to.

We say no more.

üëï Dress up as a worker‚Äîyour job, or one you admire.
ü™ß Make a sign that shows what that worker deserves‚Äîand what‚Äôs at risk.

üë®‚Äçüë©‚Äçüëß This is a peaceful, family-friendly protest.
‚úäWear red, white, and blue to show we are the real patriots.
üö´ No profanity on signs‚Äîour message is strong without it.

--------------

üõ† WHAT IS MAY DAY?

May Day‚ÄîInternational Workers‚Äô Day‚Äîhonors the people who built this country.

It began with American workers striking in 1886 for the eight-hour workday. When police opened fire on protesters at Chicago‚Äôs Haymarket Square, it became a global symbol of the fight for dignity on the job.

Governments around the world now recognize May 1st as a day to stand with labor. But in the U.S., we‚Äôve been told to forget.

We remember. May Day belongs to us. And we‚Äôre reclaiming it.

--------------

üßçüèΩ‚Äç‚ôÄÔ∏è EXAMPLES: LOCAL WORKERS, LOCAL POWER

üõí Retail Worker (Publix, Target, Home Depot) with a sign that says, ‚ÄúWe stock your shelves. Don‚Äôt empty our paychecks.‚Äù

üë©üèΩ‚Äç‚öïÔ∏è Healthcare Worker (Nurse, Tech, Aide) with a sign that says, ‚ÄúWe care for your family. Let us care for ours.‚Äù

üìö Teacher or School Staff with a sign that says, ‚ÄúLet us teach. Keep politics out of the classroom.‚Äù

üçΩ Restaurant or Food Service Worker with a sign that says, ‚ÄúWe served through the storm. We deserve better.‚Äù

üíº Office Worker / Business Services with a sign that says, ‚ÄúWe‚Äôre not overhead. We‚Äôre the engine.‚Äù

üë∑ Construction Worker with a sign that says, ‚ÄúWe build Woodstock. Give us a future here.‚Äù

‚öôÔ∏è Manufacturing or Warehouse Worker with a sign that says, ‚ÄúWe move the goods. Respect the hands behind the supply chain.‚Äù

--------------

‚úä WHAT TO EXPECT:

We‚Äôll line up peacefully along the sidewalk in downtown Woodstock with signs and costumes

This is a legal, unpermitted protest: we will obey all laws and exercise our First Amendment rights without blocking traffic or pedestrians

--------------

üîß HOW TO JOIN:

- Pick your worker costume
- Make your sign (no profanity)
- Wear red, white, and blue

üìç Meeting location will be announced soon.

RSVP & follow for updates:

Instagram: @indivisiblewoodstockcan

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=61573799888446

Bluesky: https://bsky.app/profile/woodstockcan.bsky.social

May Day isn‚Äôt a memory. It‚Äôs a movement.
This is our moment to show who really makes this town strong. Not Wall Street. Not the lobbyists. The workers. The people. Us.
